intro: Agapanthus campanulatus subsp. patens, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It features striking blue to purple bell-shaped flowers that bloom in summer, arranged in dense, upright clusters. The plant has strap-like, evergreen leaves that are narrow and grass-like in appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and rockeries. Its botanical characteristics make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in its native habitat.
